etymology.description: 广(廣) (guǎng, "shelter") + 車(车) (chē, "vehicle") = shelter for vehicles -> warehouse; storehouse
etymology.interpretation: The character 库(庫) (kù) combines 广(廣) (guǎng, "shelter"), depicting a spacious building, with 車(车) (chē, "vehicle"), indicating its use as a place to house vehicles or goods. This combination suggests a structure designed for storage purposes.
etymology.simplification: 庫(庫)→库(庫): 車(车) (chē, "vehicle") was replaced with a simpler form of the character, adopting the same phonetic properties.

examples.chinese: 货物被安全存储在库中(貨物被安全存儲在庫中)。
examples.pinyin: Huòwù bèi ānquán cúnchǔ zài kù zhōng.
examples.english: The goods are safely stored in the warehouse.

examples.chinese: 公司收到新材料(公司收到新材料)，立即将其分类存入库(立即將其分類存入庫)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī shōudào xīn cáiliào, lìjí jiāng qí fēnlèi cúnrù kù.
examples.english: The company received new materials and immediately sorted them into the warehouse.
